item.title: Question Time
item.dc:creator: mice@mindless.com
item.content:encoded:
From Chlotsuintha Ague
A few simple questions; Have you figured out the actors?

Does that answer your questions?

item.title: Empire of Night
item.dc:creator: mice@mindless.com
item.content:encoded:
Justin is excited as he is close to finishing the first draft of EMPIRE OF NIGHT. He says "I can honestly say that I have never enjoyed writing as much as in the last few weeks."

The book will still be released in March in the United Kingdom but sadly the US date has slipped. Justin wrote in his blog "I’m afraid that you will have to wait just a bit longer for it as it will now be published August 1st 2010. This is because it has taken me a bit longer to write than we’d hoped, but I promise you guys it will be worth the wait."

item.title: New Way Of Reading
item.dc:creator: mice@mindless.com
item.content:encoded:
I have just had an email that sound curious. Apparently Nintendo DS will soon be releasing the Flips range -- a new series on Nintendo DS designed to give children of all ages a fun new way to read their favourite books (including Artemis Fowl by Eoin Colfer). Flips uses the DS touch screen and stylus to enable children to read and interact by combining the world of storytelling with quizzes and references to characters.

So what does Eoin Colfer think "I'm over the moon to see my stories and characters brought to life on the Nintendo DS with the new FLIPS range. Everyone knows that reading improves literacy skills. I have two children who are DS fanatics and cannot wait for the FLIPS to arrive, so EA might finally get them reading my books!"

item.title: Bath Festival of Children's Literature
item.dc:creator: mice@mindless.com
item.content:encoded:
The Bath Festival of Children's Literature would have finished today. I hope everyone who went enjoyed themselves. It sounded like a brilliant festival with several good books and authors listed including Jeremy Strong and Terry Deary (Horrible Histories). Syren (Septimus Heap book 5) by Angie Sage was also listed, it is out in the UK as far as I can tell, but due out in Canada (and probably America) on 29th September. Dreadnought (H.I.V.E book 4) by Mark Walden thankfully was also listed, I had not realised it had been released in the UK as here they don't seem to have heard of book 3! (Time to talk really nicely to my Mother-in-Law).

Don't forget you can still see Justin Somper at the Appledore Book Festival, on Thursday 1st October 2009, from 7.00pm he will be at St. Mary’s Primary School (£3) and the Cheltenham Festival of Literature, on Saturday 17th October 2009 with Maggie Stiefvater.

item.title: Book Festivals
item.dc:creator: mice@mindless.com
item.content:encoded:
I really enjoyed seeing Justin Somper explain about the Vampirate set of books and getting the chance to get my books signed. Below are a list of six public events where Justin Somper will be attending.

Friday 22nd August 2009, From 3:00 to 4:00 pm
Edinburgh International Book Festival
The seafaring nightwalkers return! Swashbuckling author Justin Somper reveals his newest plans for the bloodsucking sailors and reads from the latest Vampirates instalment: Black Heart. A thrilling piratical party awaits you, if you dare to join in.
RBS Corner Theatre - £4

Saturday 12th September 2009
Dun Laoghaire Rathdown Libraries and County Council Literary Festival, Dublin.

Sunday 13th September 2009, From 12.00pm to 1.00pm
Hampstead Literary Festival Voyage of the Vampirates - £3


Saturday 26th September 2009, From 5.00 to 5.45pm
Bath Festival of Children's Literature
Return of the Vampirates with Justin Somper,
The bestselling and blood-curdling Vampirates sequence fuses pirate history and vampire myth into page-turning, award-winning, genre-busting fiction. In the words of Darren Shan, “an intriguing mix of piracy and vampirism... bravo!” Justin returns to Bath to talk about how he creates his unique books, including his latest bestseller, Black Heart, and answer questions from all attending FanPirates!
Bath Central Library - £4.50

Thursday 1st October 2009, From 7.00pm
Appledore Book Festival Justin Somper Meet Vampirate Man
Justin Somper is the best-selling author of the internationally acclaimed Vampirates sequence, now published in over 25 countries. The idea to fuse pirate adventure and vampire myth came to Somper in a ‘Eureka!’ moment. In the words of Darren Shan, ‘an intriguing mix of piracy and vampirism… bravo!’ The latest title in the sequence is Black Heart.
St. Mary’s Primary School (children to be accompanied by an adult) - £3

Saturday 17th October 2009, From 5:15 pm (60mins)
Cheltenham Festival of Literature
Breaking the Rules: Vampires vs Werewolves: Justin Somper & Maggie Stiefvater
Join Justin Somper, bestselling author of Vampirates, and Maggie Stiefvater, author of the exciting new wolf novel Shiver, as they discuss the good, the terrifying and the compellingly attractive sides to their characters. Which would you rather meet on a dark night — vampires or werewolves?
The Playhouse - £4

For more details please see the official vampirates website on www.vampirates.co.uk/stop-press
